11243Transition Metal ChemistryTransition Metal Chemistry0340-42851572-901XKluwer Academic PublishersDordrechtArt1538514810.1023/A:1015644126830ArticleSynthesis, crystal structure and properties of a one-dimensional polymeric copper(II) complex of tetrachlorophthalateYangShi-Yao1LongLa-Sheng1WuZhen-Yi1ZhanMeng-Xiong1HuangRong-Bin1ZhengLan-Sun1grid.12955.3a0000000122647233State Key Laboratory for Physical Chemistry of Solid SurfacesXiamen University361005XiamenPeople's Republic of China8200227554654918102004© Kluwer Academic Publishers 20022002Abstract

The coordination polymer [Cu2L2(H2O)6 · 2(H2O)]n (L = μ-tetrachlorophthalate dianion) has been synthesized and characterized by X-ray crystallography, i.r. spectroscopy, electronic spectroscopy and cyclic voltammetry. The structure of the complex is a one-dimensional zigzag chain. The i.r. spectra reveal that the tetrachlorophthalate groups are bismonodentate ligands, and this is confirmed by the crystal structure determination. Cyclic voltammetry reveals two steps of a quasi-reversible oxidation–reduction processes for the complex.

elements.content: The coordination polymer [Cu2L2(H2O)6 · 2(H2O)]n (L = μ-tetrachlorophthalate dianion) has been synthesized and characterized by X-ray crystallography, i.r. spectroscopy, electronic spectroscopy and cyclic voltammetry. The structure of the complex is a one-dimensional zigzag chain. The i.r. spectra reveal that the tetrachlorophthalate groups are bismonodentate ligands, and this is confirmed by the crystal structure determination. Cyclic voltammetry reveals two steps of a quasi-reversible oxidation–reduction processes for the complex.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

The coordination polymer [Cu2L2(H2O)6 ⋅ 2(H2O)]n (L = μ-tetrachlorophthalate dianion) has been synthesized and characterized by X-ray crystallography, i.r. spectroscopy, electronic spectroscopy and cyclic voltammetry. The structure of the complex is a one-dimensional zigzag chain. The i.r. spectra reveal that the tetrachlorophthalate groups are bismonodentate ligands, and this is confirmed by the crystal structure determination. Cyclic voltammetry reveals two steps of a quasi-reversible oxidation-reduction processes for the complex.
